info.title: Employees
info.description: API to interact with Nmbr Payroll

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sort query parameter allows you to control the order of results in the response. Sorting is specified using the format:
sort=field:direction[,field:direction,...]
- field: The name of the field to sort by.
- direction: Optional sort direction, may be `asc` or `desc`

Sortable fields are `first_name` and `last_name`

parameters.name: payee_type
parameters.description:
Possible values: `employee`, `contractor`.

Filter response by payee type, one of `employee` or `contractor`.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sort query parameter allows you to control the order of results in the response. Sorting is specified using the format:
sort=field:direction[,field:direction,...]
- field: The name of the field to sort by.
- direction: Optional sort direction, may be `asc` or `desc`

Sortable fields are `payee.default`, `payee.first_name` and `payee.last_name`

parameters.name: effective_from
parameters.description:
This parameter allows filtering by date and supports two formats:
Exact Date Match: Provide a well-formatted date in yyyy-mm-dd format for an exact match. Example: effective_from=2024-01-01.
Use an array-like syntax to specify a range with one or more comparison operators:
- gt (greater than)
- gte (greater than or equal to)
- lte (less than or equal to)
- lt (less than)
Example: effective_from[gte]=2024-01-01&effective_from[lt]=2024-12-31

parameters.name: effective_to
parameters.description:
This parameter allows filtering by date and supports two formats:
Exact Date Match: Provide a well-formatted date in yyyy-mm-dd format for an exact match. Example: effective_to=2024-01-01.
Use an array-like syntax to specify a range with one or more comparison operators:
- gt (greater than)
- gte (greater than or equal to)
- lte (less than or equal to)
- lt (less than)
Example: effective_to[gte]=2024-01-01&effective_to[lt]=2024-12-31

parameters.name: work_assignment_id
parameters.description: The `work_assignment_id` field is required when `employee_id` is not present.

post.description: Endpoint to create a Form for an Employee. The following example is for a 2023 TD1, but the response fields will differ depending on the specific Form instance requested.

get.description: Endpoint to fetch a Form for an Employee. The following example is for a 2023 TD1, but the response fields will differ depending on the specific Form instance requested.

put.description: Endpoint to update a Form for an Employee. The following example is for a 2023 TD1, but the response fields will differ depending on the specific Form instance requested.

amount.description:
This is the actual amount for this line item.
Deprecation-Notice: The 'amount' attribute is deprecated for write usage and will be read-only in a future release.
It should be used as read-only. Use `custom_amount` to set the line item dollar amount.

amount_override.description: Use `custom_amount` to set the line item dollar amount.

custom_amount.description: Can be used to set the amount for this line item, this will be used over `managed_amount`.

managed_amount.description: This is the system calculated amount on managed line items.

is_managed.description:
When true, this line item is managed by its Recurrence entity.
Only the `custom_amount` and `custom_hours` may be updated. The line item may not be deleted.

hours.description:
The actual number of hours worked for this earning line item.
Deprecation Notice: This attribute will be made read-only in a future update, please use the `custom_hours` attribute.

managed_hours.description: Read-only value, this value is the default number of hours on a managed Salary or Wage.

custom_hours.description:
The user defined number of hours worked for this earning line item, this can be used set or update the number of hours worked in the period.
The `custom_hours` can be used to prorate the dollar `amount` on Salaried line items with a Pay Rate.

is_managed.description: Always true for EmployerStatutoryWithholdingLineItems, these items may not be created, updated or destroyed.

frequency.description:
The frequency that the Allowance is added to an Employees PayStub.
If `per_month` is selected, the allowance is evenly distributed across all Payrolls in the month.

is_managed.description:
When true, this line item is managed by its Recurrence entity.
Only the `amount_override` may be updated. The line item may not be deleted.

amount.description:
This is the actual amount for this line item.
Deprecation-Notice: The 'amount' attribute is deprecated for write usage and will be read-only in a future release.
It should be used as read-only. Use `custom_amount` to set the line item dollar amount.

amount_override.description: Use `custom_amount` to set the line item dollar amount.

custom_amount.description: Can be used to set the amount for this line item, this will be used over `managed_amount`.

managed_amount.description: This is the calculated amount on managed line items.

income_basis.description:
Determines the income used for percentage-based benefits:
`regular_earnings` - only includes `salary` and `wage` (default).
`total_income` - Includes all earnings, taxable allowances, and taxable reimbursements.

is_managed.description:
When true, this line item is managed by its Recurrence entity.
Only the `amount` and `percent` overrides may be updated. The line item may not be deleted.

employer_ei_multiplier.description:
Attribute has been deprecated and is red only. Please use Tax Properties to
read or write an EI Premium Reduction value.

supported_payroll_types.description: A map of payroll types, if `false`, this earning-type is not supported on that Payroll Type.

is_editable.description: After a PayRate is on a non-draft payroll, its Type and Rate may not be updated.

is_deletable.description: After a PayRate is on a non-draft payroll, it may not be deleted.

is_editable.description: After a PayRate is on a non-draft payroll, its Type and Rate may not be updated.

is_deletable.description: After a PayRate is on a non-draft payroll, it may not be deleted.

earliest_valid_effective_to.description: The earliest date on which the PayRate's effective_to can set.

is_editable.description:
A pay schedule may not be edited after any of its payrolls are in a non-draft state.
When `is_editable` is false, editing is restricted to the `title` attribute only.

debit_date.description: The expected date your account will be debited the `cash_requirement` amount

approval_due_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, that this payroll must be approved by to be processed on time.

regular_periods_count.description: The number of Regular periods in the same year as this payroll.

is_impacted_by_weekend_or_holiday.description: Whether pay_date or approval_due_at has been moved to avoid bank holidays or weekends

amount.description: Amount may be synced from the Template.

effective_from.description: Effective From may be synced from the Template.

effective_to.description: Effective To may be synced from the Template.

is_managed.description:
When true, this line item is managed by its Recurrence entity.
Only the `amount_override` may be updated. The line item may not be deleted.

is_managed.description: If true, this is a default Remittance Account and can not be updated or deleted.
Always true for StatutoryWithholdingLineItems, these items may not be created, updated or destroyed.

is_editable.description: When false, only the `effective_to` attribute may be updated.
When false, only the `effective_to` attribute may be updated.

is_primary.description:
The primary Work Assignment has Tax Credits applied, only one may be Primary per employee per Business Entity.
If no Work Assignments are set to be the Primary, the oldest will be set by default.

last_non_draft_period_end.description:
The last date on which there is a non-draft payroll.
After this date, all payrolls for this work assignment are in draft.

work_assignment_id.description: The work_assignment_id must belong to a work assignment associated with an entity of type Employee.

The attribute must be present when `business_entity_allowance_id` is either empty or not set.

frequency.description:
`once`, `per_payroll`, `per_month`

The frequency that the Allowance is added to an Employees PayStub.
If `per_month` is selected, the allowance is evenly distributed across all Payrolls in the month.

pay_rate_id.description:
pay_rates

On line items of type `wage` and `overtime` you may pass a `pay_rate_id` and `hours` to
automatically calculate the `amount`.

overtime_rate_id.description:
overtime_rates
The attribute must not be present unless the `earning_type` is `overtime`.

On line items of type `overtime` you may pass a `overtime_rate_id` and `hours` to
automatically calculate the `amount`.

anchor_pay_date.description: Date must not be more than one year before now.

anchor_end_of_pay_period.description: Date must not be more than one year before now.

`weekly`, `bi-weekly`, `semi-monthly`, `monthly`

anchor_pay_date.description:
Editing is prevented when `is_editable` is false

Date must not be more than one year before pay-schedule creation.

anchor_end_of_pay_period.description:
Editing is prevented when `is_editable` is false

Date must not be more than one year before pay-schedule creation.

day_1.description:
Editing is prevented when `is_editable` is false

Day_1 is required for Monthly and Semi-Monthly Pay Schedules. Otherwise, it must be null.
On Semi-monthly Pay Schedules, valid `(day_1, day_2)` pairs are `(16, 1)`, `(15, -1)` or `(15, 31)`.

day_2.description:
Editing is prevented when `is_editable` is false

day_2 is required for Semi-Monthly Pay Schedules. Otherwise, it must be null.
On Semi-monthly Pay Schedules, valid `(day_1, day_2)` pairs are `(16, 1)`, `(15, -1)` or `(15, 31)`.

pay_day_movement_setting.description:
`inherit`, `previous_business_day`, `next_business_day`
Editing is prevented when `is_editable` is false

source_payroll_id.description: When creating a Payroll of type `off_cycle`, it must be associated with a regular payroll on the same pay-schedule.

period_start.description: When creating a payroll of type `historical`, a `period_start` date is required. A `period_start` date is prohibited on a `off_cycle` payroll.

period_end.description: When creating a payroll of type `historical`, a `period_end` date is required. A `period_end` date is prohibited on a `off_cycle` payroll.

data.html:
PAD Agreement

The Nmbr Company Ltd.

40 Temperance Street - Suite 3200

Toronto, ON

M5H 0B4

Email: billing@nmbr.co

Pre-authorized debit agreement

By accepting this Agreement, you acknowledge that you authorize The Nmbr Company Ltd. (Nmbr) to debit the specified bank account for any amount owed for charges arising from the use of services and/or purchase of products.

You acknowledge that this PAD Agreement is provided for the benefit of Nmbr and your financial institution, and in consideration of your financial institution agreeing to process debits against your account in accordance with Rule H1, and any other applicable rules of the Canadian Payments Association, as may be amended from time to time (“Rule H1”). The submission and acceptance of this PAD Agreement to Nmbr constitutes delivery by you of the same to your financial institution.

You hereby authorize Nmbr to debit/draw on your account specified above with your financial institution for the purpose of funding any third-party payments, which may include, without limitation, payroll/compensation payments to your employees and payments to taxing authorities on your behalf, as well as the fees and other charges for such services rendered by Nmbr (each such debit hereinafter referred to as a “PAD”). You understand and agree that the PADs will be for variable amounts as required to meet your obligations for payroll, taxes, fees, and other charges as contemplated in the applicable services agreement(s). The PADs will occur at recurring set intervals triggered by your pre-determined payroll processing schedule (regular and off-cycle) and corresponding funding deadline established by Nmbr in accordance with your services agreement for such payroll obligations, or for variable amounts as and when required in response to any other direct actions initiated by you either electronically, in writing, or by telephone. The PADs authorized and issued hereunder are “Business PADs” as defined in Rule H1.

You acknowledge and agree that the amounts debited may vary as instructed and approved by you, and as such, no pre-notification of PAD changes is required.

You further agree to a reduced confirmation period, whereby you will be notified of the first upcoming debit up to 1 (one) day before the payment is collected, instead of the standard 10 days.

You represent and warrant that as of the execution date of this PAD Agreement, all persons whose signatures are required to sign on the account identified above have read and accepted this PAD Agreement (or the names and specimen signatures of such persons have been provided to Nmbr in a separate document).

You may amend or cancel this authorization at any time by providing no less than thirty (30) days notice, prior to the next scheduled PAD, at billing@nmbr.co. This will not affect any debit transactions initiated prior to Nmbr acknowledging the amendment or cancellation. To obtain a sample cancellation form, or further information on cancelling a PAD agreement, please contact your financial institution or visit www.payments.ca.

This PAD Agreement applies only to the method of payment and does not otherwise affect the Agreement or any other applicable terms governing the Services to which this PAD Agreement relates. Revocation of the authorization granted hereunder does not in and of itself terminate any such Agreement(s) between you and Nmbr, however, you acknowledge that the performance of the Services requires that either a valid PAD Agreement be in place or another mutually acceptable method of payment be established between you and Nmbr.

You acknowledge that your financial institution is not required to verify that: (a) a PAD has been issued in accordance with this PAD Agreement including, but not limited to, the amount; or (b) any purpose of payment for which the PAD was issued has been fulfilled by Nmbr as a condition to honoring a PAD issued or caused to be issued by Nmbr on your account.

You have certain recourse rights if any debit does not comply with this agreement. For example, you have the right to receive reimbursement for any debit that is not authorized or is not consistent with this PAD Agreement. To obtain more information on your recourse rights, you can contact your financial institution or visit   www.payments.ca .

A PAD may be disputed by you if: (i) the PAD was not drawn in accordance with this PAD Agreement; or (ii) this PAD Agreement is revoked or terminated in accordance with the terms hereof (effective prior to such PAD being issued). To be reimbursed, you must complete and present a declaration to the branch of your financial institution in which your account is held no later than the close of business on the tenth (10th) business day after the date on which the PAD in dispute was debited from your account.

You acknowledge that, after such date, a claim on the basis that the PAD Agreement was revoked or terminated, or for any other reason, is a matter to be resolved solely between Nmbr and you.

You consent to the disclosure of any personal information contained herein to Nmbr’s sponsoring member (as defined in Rule H1) as far as any such disclosure of personal information is directly related to and necessary for the proper application of Rule H1.

Any inquiries or notices relative to the PAD Agreement and the debits issued hereunder shall be directed to Nmbr at the address provided above.

Nmbr may assign this PAD Agreement without your consent provided that Nmbr has provided you with written notice of the details of such assignment including the identity and contact information of the assignee.

You hereby certify that all information supplied by you herein is true, complete, and accurate in every respect. You have caused an authorized signing officer of the Client to execute this PAD Agreement as of the date specified above.
